fields.description:
If a gadget subscription is created using a URL that does not exactly match the base URL, gadgets added via pub sub do not appear in the directory.

For example:
1) As a sysadmin, from the dashboard, click "Add Gadget->Gadget Subscriptions->Add Subscription"
2) Enter "http://extranet.atlassian.com/jira" (note: HTTP)
A gadget subscription is created for "https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira" (note: HTTPS).
3) Open the linked subscription in a new tab and see that there are 41 gadgets there.
4) In the original window, click "Back" and try to find any of the new gadgets.

They won't be there, because the gadgets are being served from HTTPS but the whitelist entry is for HTTP.

Although this was user error (the URL I entered was not precisely the base URL for the instance), JIRA has historically never been picky about base URLs and there is no indication to the user of what has gone wrong.

This could be fixed by creating the whitelist entry from the subscription URL and not the URL that was originally entered.
fields.summary: Gadget subscriptions whitelist the entered URL, not the base URL retrieved from the system

fields.description:
We have been stung by this at least 3 times now. We are putting classes inside the markup so we can test things. Can we PLEASE not do this. We have jquery selector magic in selenium now so we really shouldn't need to be doing this.

The issue is because we probably changed it from Link Issue to just Link. Then we append "link" to the class "aui-list-item-" and end up with aui-list-item-link which is already an existing class. We had this happen with "footer" and one other previously.
fields.summary: Link issue action entry in the dot dialog is inheriting incorrect styles

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Install JIRA.
2. Start JIRA. User has JDJ 1.5 installed on his/her machine.

Result:
1. JIRA fails with stack trace which is no where useful that JIRA doesn't suport JDK/JRE 1.5.

Expected:
1. User should get a user friendly error  message explaining the cause of issue.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't give user any information if user try to start JIRa with JDK/JRE 1.5

fields.description:

fields.description:
Test code:

{noformat}
curl -i -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username": "myuser","password":"mypass"}' 'https://jdog.atlassian.com/rest/auth/1/session'
{noformat}

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Setup JIRA behind apache using docs at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache
2. Goto Admin->Applinks.
3. Try to create a two way applinks to any application. I tried creating with Fisheye. In the step 2 check "Create a link back to this server.", enter user id and pwd and click "next".

Result:
1. It fail with error "The Remote application is not able to connect to 'JIRA Test-171'(JIRA) by using the URL 'http://172.20.9.68/jira'"
fields.summary: User can't create an Applink when JIRA is behind the apache proxy

fields.description: The expand-twiddles ("Advanced Settings", "User Schema Settings", "Group Schema Settings", "Membership Schema Settings") don't work when you click on then. For a minute I thought it was entirely broken until I thought to try clicking on the title. That works. But I think most users will expect clicking on the twiddle to work and be surprised when nothing happens.
fields.summary: Click twiddles in LDAP Config doesn't work in IE7

fields.description:
On the View Issue page, we have a rubbish-bin icon for deleting an issue link. It is a bit unclear, because the row it's on only contains data about the issue that's being linked to, and on first glance it seems like you are actually deleting the issue rather than the link to it. Everywhere else we use this icon, it means "delete this thing" - e.g. on a comment.

Perhaps we could have a different icon, such as a link with a cross through it, to indicate we are breaking the link, not deleting the issue.

!DeleteLinkIcon.png!
fields.summary: Icon for deleting an issue link is misleading

fields.description:
- Create a user
- Create a project and make new user the lead.
- Go to User Browser
- Select the new user and click "Delete"
- At this point you will reach the "Delete User" screen, that will have the following error message: 
This user cannot be deleted at this time because there are issues assigned to them, they have reported issues, or they are currently the lead of a project.
Please note that any components with this user set as the lead will have the component lead set to empty when the user is deleted.
- Click on the project link

*Expected:* Load the project home screen

*Actual:* Error message appears: There is not a project with the specified id. Perhaps it was deleted

fields.description:
On qa-jac I am getting errors when I try to create an App Link:

bq. The URL 'http:/jira.atlassian.com' is not valid. java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Host name may not be null

Reportedly this is caused by "misconfigured" proxy servers.
Perhaps the proxy is trying to normalise the URL in order to do more efficient caching?

It seems that this could hit support a fair bit, so it seems best to just get this fixed.
fields.summary: App Links should be able to handle proxy servers that collapse repeated slashes.

fields.description:
Its looks like it is crowd embedded that actually does this. It looks like the logging is proportional to the number of groups. We don't need this much detail in the logs it will blow their size out of large LDAP directories. Admins of JIRA really don't care about these details. If they need to DEBUG performance problems then they should enable debugging rather than having it on by default. We should:

# Filter out these messages in JIRA's log4j properties.

We can (should?) keep around the "synchronisation" started and "synchronisation" finished logs when we fix this.

For example, here is a sync with a small directory of ~ 10 users and ~ 5 groups.

fields.description: Since it is an HTTP GET and doesn't have a confirmation screen it is somewhat easy for automated things to accidentally delete your configuration. Since it is an admin screen we are mostly safe, since google won't be crawling it, but most (all?) other destructive operations in JIRA have a confirmation so it is was surprising that this one didn't.

fields.description:
There are a lot of discussions on the web and also for jira whether or not external links can be opened in new window (tab) or use the same page. I know you could hold CTR and click link to open in new window but this is not the answer for most people like and me.  Some say that opening links in new window would valuate web principal for user to be in control others do not agree and prefer links to be opened in new window. So to satisfy all my suggestion is this. 
Please add a property inside the main jira-application.properties file. When this property is = to OFF the menu will behave the way how is now for all links in the main menu. When is ON then only the newly added links via plugins will open in new window(tab). This way the Administrator of Jira will decide how newly added links to open in the same page or in new window(tab).
fields.summary: Open links from top navigation bar in new window
Creating Service Reference from JIRA WSDL in Visual Studio 2010 generates all methods void

fields.description:
During upgrade 4.1 to 4.3 Migrate User Directory configuration set Delegated LDAP with full access by default and We cannot change it later through the Web interface.

In our installation we use LDAP anonymous bind and JIRA hasn't write access to LDAP.

content of cwd_directory_operation shown below
{noformat}
 directory_id |     operation_type
--------------+------------------------
            3 | DELETE_GROUP
            3 | CREATE_GROUP
            3 | UPDATE_USER_ATTRIBUTE
            3 | CREATE_ROLE
            3 | DELETE_USER
            3 | UPDATE_ROLE
            3 | UPDATE_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE
            3 | DELETE_ROLE
            3 | UPDATE_USER
            3 | UPDATE_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE
            3 | CREATE_USER
            3 | UPDATE_GROUP
{noformat}
The real problem is when Delegated LDAP is first at User Directories list because when new user is created he is automatically assigned to the Delegated LDAP directory (as Mark Lassau wrote in [Local users can't log in but LDAP users can after upgrade to v4.3|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Local+users+can't+log+in+but+LDAP+users+can+after+upgrade+to+v4.3]: JIRA currently will only add users to the first writable directory).

and result is:If the New user doesn't exist in LDAP he will not be able to log in into the JIRA.
fields.summary: Migrate User Directory configuration allow to CREATE/UPDATE user by default although it has no write access to LDAP.

fields.description: When I do a filter the issues for a project by selecting "Any" issue type, the custom fields selected are not showing. I know if I select the issue types which have this fields associated then the fields will be displayed. But this is not a good method because the users might not be knowing this well. It should show the fields in navigator and display the values which are existing for the issues and keep this filed empty for others.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator should show all the selected fields eventhough the issue type doesn't have that

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

As mentioned in the support request:    JSP-75155

I've noticed that if a mail with "high priority" is sent to the jira ticket creation mailbox (Jira standard Create and Comment Handler) a BLOCKER ticket is created. 

I think it would be very useful to have the possibility to activate/deactivate this behaviour via a flag as for the other options, something like autoAssignPriority=false. 

Even if Jira is a general purpose tool one of the main usage remain as a ticketing system for support processes. And one fundamental of any support process is that is not the customer that assign the priority of a ticket but the 1st level. (the customer of course gives information about the priority but he is not the one who decides which ticket is handled first...)

 Regards
fields.summary: Issue Create from mail Handler parameters - make possible to deactivate auto priority assignment when email priority is set to "high"

fields.description:
Issue Created via Email will has the Priority set to non-default if the user create the email in Mail Client that able to define the value of the Priority Header. For example, Outlook or Thunderbird is able to set the Priority of the Email. 

Suggested Documentation to be improve is [Creating Issues and Comment via Email|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email] and tt should has a warn that this feature is exist in JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23934].
  {panel}

See [CONF-20426].


If JIRA and Confluence are installed on the same machine and on the same context path, then it's impossible to add JIRA gadgets to the Confluence RTE. You can still paste the gadget XML into the wiki markup editor.

What does this mean?

a) Different servers: http://myserver:8080 + http://yourserver:8080
b) Same server, different context path: http://myserver:8080/jira + http://myserver:8081/confluence
c) Same server, same context path: http://myserver:8080 + http://myserver:8081.
Scenario (c) is the problem, (a) and (b) appear to be fine.

This configuration is normal in two cases:

# Any customer following Here Be Dragons (550+ customers to date)
# Anyone using the Inception Installers for JIRA and Confluence on the same box. (most BTF customers from mid-to-late 2011).


h3. What's the customer effect?

JIRA gadgets become useless in Confluence pages without an opaque workaround which will become impossible on the release of Confluence 4.0. For example, it's impossible for a customer to build a release dashboard in Confluence. We've had to yank that functionality from the Dragon's guide today as "please paste this opaque blob of gadget XML into a page" is a shit user experience. 

h3. Solution?

We need a solution that allows customers to deploy Atlassian applications on the same server and still be able to use gadgets.
fields.summary: JIRA gadgets cannot be used in Confluence if both applications are installed on the same server & context path

fields.description:
Create New User page doesn't allow administrator to specify in which User Directory a new user will get created.

!NewUser.png!

In the current implementation the user will get created in the first directory with write access rights listed in User Directories.

In compare in Crowd an administrator is able to specify directory where user should get created.


!http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/18579611/Add+User.png?version=1&modificationDate=1203463368162!

In many cases JIRA administrator needs to define the directory while creating users for example different directory needs to be used for employees and customers.

fields.description: There are classes inside the markup that match the value returned which are in turn matching existing css classes. This issue occurred because we changed it from Link Issue to just Link. Then we append "link" to the class "aui-list-item-" and end up with aui-list-item-link which is already an existing class. We had this happen with "footer" and one other previously.
fields.summary: Link issue action entry in the dot dialog is inheriting incorrect styles

fields.description:
Steps needed to reproduce the behaviour:
# Navigate to a page from the admin requiring Administrator Access such as 'User Directories'.
# Authenticate to generate 'Administrator Sessions' and let session expire while on the page.
# Enter some data into forms and submit the page.
# Administrator Access authentication page is displayed, but info provided in the forms is lost!

The applicators should either preserve the form content or execute/apply the change when user re-authenticate. Similar functionality already exists for preserving comments and info entered in the transition screens when user session expires.
fields.summary: Applying changes when Administrator Sessions expires loses form data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23924].
  {panel}

We need JQL aliases that reflect the new terms used on the 4.2 "View Issue" page, i.e.:

    * originalEstimate needs a new alias called "estimated"
    * remainingEstimate needs a new alias called "remaining"
    * timeSpent needs a new alias called "logged"
fields.summary: "Remaining", "Estimated" & "Logged" don't work in JQL
Handle missing avatars in a user-friendly way

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23922].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Setup JIRA.
2. Create a project and choose "default notification scheme" for it.
3. User forget to add entry for mail server in Admin->mail server.
4. Create an issue. Goto "Admin->Mail Queue". The e-mail notifications are listed there. Flush queue or you can wait for it to go automatically.

Result:
1. There are no entry in "error queue".
2. There is a message in log file which is not very obvious 

{noformat}
"2010-07-16 16:15:26,069 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@8667df7[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@454e119d[id=10000,summary=This is a major test,key=TS-1,created=2010-07-16 16:14:47.453,updated=2010-07-16 16:14:47.453,assignee=admin,reporter=veenu],remoteUser=veenu,notificationType=Current_Assignee,eventTypeId=1,templateId=1] WARN admin 975x246x1 1heh7p9 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem] There is no default SMTP Mail server so mail cannot be sent"
{noformat}

Expected:
1. A better error handling....
fields.summary: User can't see any failed notification under "error queue" if there is no mail server configured in JIRA
Components tooltip should show the description of the component, and not the component name itself

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23920].
  {panel}

Check this image:
!jira-ui-enhancement.png!

Making the whole area clickable would be great.

I know that the link is the person's name, but that big blue bar is the same colour and as such is *so* tempting to treat as a link, so I always try the bar first.

I guess instead, you could also change the colour of the bar so it is not confused as a hyperlink.
fields.summary: JIRA UI issue link enhancement

fields.description:
In the Creating Issues and Comments from Email documentation, topic 'Issue/Comment Creation', is described that for JIRA create or comment an issue, it examines the email subject and the in-reply-to message for an existing issue reference. 

I believe it's not very clear how the handler works. It'd be interesting if there was a info box or something clarifying or giving examples on how this exactly works. If we compare this info with the topic bellow it, 'Handler Parameters', it becomes hard to understand the functionality, once it says that for comment creating, the mail subject must have an issue key.

Following the doc web link: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-Issue%2FCommentCreation]
fields.summary: Improving Creating Issues and Comments from Email documentation
